name: Let's Meetup and have an Android Study Jam
description: Android Study Jam for Beginners

name: IWD Banjul 2018
description:
• What we'll do
We are proud to be hosting the 2018 International Women's Day Celebration, a women's tech conference. This event will highlight the stories of our growing female community of designers, developers, and technology entrepreneurs.

• What to bring
Please bring a Laptop! if you don't have one that's okay too :)

Agenda:
10:00-10:30
Registration
10:30-10:40
Welcoming Remarks
10:40-11:10
Ice Breakers
11:10-12:10
Experience sharing,Panel discussion / Q&A session
12:10-13:10
Protecting yourself online
13:10-14:00
Lunch Break
14:00-16:00
Codelabs Session - Build your first Android app in Java
16:00
Closing Remarks/ Networking

name: Android Development for Beginners
description:
If you're new to programming, and want to learn how to build Android apps, Please join us at the Gambia YMCA on MDI Road! You don’t need any programming experience to attend.

Please bring a laptop.

name: Jokkolabs International Women's Day Celebrations
description:
As part of the International Women’s Day celebrations, Jokkolabs Banjul we will be hosting “Be Bold for Change” on Thursday, March 7th 2019 starting at 10:00am, in collaboration with GDG Banjul and SHOAW Gambia, an initiative that seeks to address the increasing harassment and online abuse of women and girls in The Gambia. The event shall take place in Jokkolabs Banjul at the YMCAs Computer Training Centre and Digital Studio, opposite MDI.

This event will focus on the online and in person harassment of girls in the community. We have invited local community organizations that focus on empowering women and girls to speak about what they do, how girls can get involved, and the resources available to them. Following the showcase, we will have a group discussion around questions that the girls may have around harassment in the community. Finally, we will have a breakout session with all the students to help create lists of what they can do to keep themselves safe both online and in person, each group will share their list in a short presentation with the larger group.
how_to_find_us: We're located in the YMCA building, opposite MDI, in Kanifing South.
